Product Title: Three Movies of the Heart: Change of Heart, Her Desperate Choice, The Truth About Jane (3 Disc Set)
Review Date: 2017/04/26
Store: Stockard Channing  (Actor),     Jean Smart  (Actor),     Arvin Brown  (Director),     Michael Scott  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, LGBT
Product Description: ["Three emotional and dramatic Movies of the Heart:Change of Heart - Beneath Jim Marshall's (John Terry) veneer as the all-American father and husband lies a long suppressed desire that is about to ruin his idyllic family. When Elaine Marshall (Jean Smart) catches her husband and his lover in a hotel room, her anger quickly turns to shock as she discovers that Jim's paramour is a young man. What ensues is painful soul-searching for Jim, Elaine, and their family.Her Desperate Choice - Despite allegations of sexual abuse against her ex-husband, Jody (Faith Ford) has lost a custody battle for Samantha (Hanna Hall) and faces a choice of turning her daughter over to him, or taking flight and risking kidnapping charges. Pursued by both the FBI and a private detective, Jody and Samantha become hunted animals, fleeing from town to town with the help of an Underground Railroad set up to help women and children escape from abuse.The Truth About Jane - Jane's mom (Stockard Channing) assumes her daughter is just like every other sixteen-year-old girl - a little confused about growing up. Jane (Ellen Muth) figures her mom is just like every other mom - a little too protective, but loving. They figure they have a good relationship, until Jane falls in love with the new girl at school. Jane knows she is gay but her mom is completely unwilling to accept this fact. Their mother-daughter relationship is broken unless they can find a way to remember how much they love each other."]
Average Rating: 5.0

=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Wild Horse Redemption
Review Date: 2017/04/26
Store: Various  (Actor),     John Zaritsky  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ["Wild horses have long roamed the American West. To keep populations stable and sustainable on public lands, thousands of these magnificent creatures are taken from their herds each year and trained, sold, or put out to pasture. Some of the horses end up in the Wild Horse Inmate Program, through which inmates at the East Canon Correctional Complex (East Canon, CO) learn the non-coercive methods of horse whisperers to tame and train the horses for adoption. THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION traces the incredible stories of both the horses and the inmates, masterfully intertwining their parallel fates and their mutual struggle towards rehabilitation. The inmates' progress with their horses depends upon their ability to cultivate patience, fortitude, and empathy; interestingly, too, it is through the recognition of themselves in these wild animals that they better understand their own lives. The most stirring moments of this film capture the intimacy forged between beast and man in the dramatic space of the training ring, where both undergo extraordinary transformations. Beautifully shot in the rugged foothills and big skies of southern Colorado, THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION takes viewers on an intimate and uplifting journey of freedom, discipline, and redemption."]

Product Title: Wentworth Prison 5 [DVD]
Review Date: 2019/08/29
Store: Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Drama
Product Description: ["The complete fifth season of the Australian television drama, a reimagining of 'Prisoner Cell Block H', the popular soap broadcast between 1979 and 1986. Following the shocking death of Bea Smith at the hands of Joan Ferguson (Pamela Rabe), Wentworth is thrown into disarray with the inmates traumatised and the staff under pressure from Corrective Services. Ferguson sinks her claws into the governor's deputies and it falls to Kaz (Tammy MacIntosh) to restore some kind of order among the inmates. The episodes are: 'Scars', 'The Bitch Is Back', 'Nothing But the Truth', 'Loose Ends', 'Belly of the Beast', 'Happy Birthday, Vera', 'The Pact', 'Think Inside the Box', 'Snakehead', 'Mere Anarchy', 'Coup de Grace' and 'Hell Bent'."]

["Wild horses have long roamed the American West. To keep populations stable and sustainable on public lands, thousands of these magnificent creatures are taken from their herds each year and trained, sold, or put out to pasture. Some of the horses end up in the Wild Horse Inmate Program, through which inmates at the East Canon Correctional Complex (East Canon, CO) learn the non-coercive methods of horse whisperers to tame and train the horses for adoption. THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION traces the incredible stories of both the horses and the inmates, masterfully intertwining their parallel fates and their mutual struggle towards rehabilitation. The inmates' progress with their horses depends upon their ability to cultivate patience, fortitude, and empathy; interestingly, too, it is through the recognition of themselves in these wild animals that they better understand their own lives. The most stirring moments of this film capture the intimacy forged between beast and man in the dramatic space of the training ring, where both undergo extraordinary transformations. Beautifully shot in the rugged foothills and big skies of southern Colorado, THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION takes viewers on an intimate and uplifting journey of freedom, discipline, and redemption."]

["The complete fifth season of the Australian television drama, a reimagining of 'Prisoner Cell Block H', the popular soap broadcast between 1979 and 1986. Following the shocking death of Bea Smith at the hands of Joan Ferguson (Pamela Rabe), Wentworth is thrown into disarray with the inmates traumatised and the staff under pressure from Corrective Services. Ferguson sinks her claws into the governor's deputies and it falls to Kaz (Tammy MacIntosh) to restore some kind of order among the inmates. The episodes are: 'Scars', 'The Bitch Is Back', 'Nothing But the Truth', 'Loose Ends', 'Belly of the Beast', 'Happy Birthday, Vera', 'The Pact', 'Think Inside the Box', 'Snakehead', 'Mere Anarchy', 'Coup de Grace' and 'Hell Bent'."]

['They have come to Earth with the promise of peace-an alien race called the Taelons. People call them "The Companions." Many see the Taelons as saviors of humankind. These few form the Resistance. With them lies the fate of humanity... and the future of Earth. Review Date: 2017/04/26
Store: Stockard Channing  (Actor),     Jean Smart  (Actor),     Arvin Brown  (Director),     Michael Scott  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, LGBT
Product Description: ["Three emotional and dramatic Movies of the Heart:Change of Heart - Beneath Jim Marshall's (John Terry) veneer as the all-American father and husband lies a long suppressed desire that is about to ruin his idyllic family. When Elaine Marshall (Jean Smart) catches her husband and his lover in a hotel room, her anger quickly turns to shock as she discovers that Jim's paramour is a young man. What ensues is painful soul-searching for Jim, Elaine, and their family.Her Desperate Choice - Despite allegations of sexual abuse against her ex-husband, Jody (Faith Ford) has lost a custody battle for Samantha (Hanna Hall) and faces a choice of turning her daughter over to him, or taking flight and risking kidnapping charges. Pursued by both the FBI and a private detective, Jody and Samantha become hunted animals, fleeing from town to town with the help of an Underground Railroad set up to help women and children escape from abuse.The Truth About Jane - Jane's mom (Stockard Channing) assumes her daughter is just like every other sixteen-year-old girl - a little confused about growing up. Jane (Ellen Muth) figures her mom is just like every other mom - a little too protective, but loving. They figure they have a good relationship, until Jane falls in love with the new girl at school. Jane knows she is gay but her mom is completely unwilling to accept this fact. Their mother-daughter relationship is broken unless they can find a way to remember how much they love each other."]

Product Title: Wild Horse Redemption
Review Date: 2017/04/26
Store: Various  (Actor),     John Zaritsky  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Documentary
Product Description: ["Wild horses have long roamed the American West. To keep populations stable and sustainable on public lands, thousands of these magnificent creatures are taken from their herds each year and trained, sold, or put out to pasture. Some of the horses end up in the Wild Horse Inmate Program, through which inmates at the East Canon Correctional Complex (East Canon, CO) learn the non-coercive methods of horse whisperers to tame and train the horses for adoption. THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION traces the incredible stories of both the horses and the inmates, masterfully intertwining their parallel fates and their mutual struggle towards rehabilitation. The inmates' progress with their horses depends upon their ability to cultivate patience, fortitude, and empathy; interestingly, too, it is through the recognition of themselves in these wild animals that they better understand their own lives. The most stirring moments of this film capture the intimacy forged between beast and man in the dramatic space of the training ring, where both undergo extraordinary transformations. Beautifully shot in the rugged foothills and big skies of southern Colorado, THE WILD HORSE REDEMPTION takes viewers on an intimate and uplifting journey of freedom, discipline, and redemption."]

Product Description: ['They have come to Earth with the promise of peace-an alien race called the Taelons. People call them "The Companions." Many see the Taelons as saviors of humankind. Indeed, they do help Earth to solve many pressing problems, such as famine and disease. But in this not-too-distant future, some are wary of the Taelons\' motives and see a darker agenda. These few form the Resistance. With them lies the fate of humanity... and the future of Earth. Collects 22 episodes on 6 discs!', "DVD Features: 16:9 widescreen; a behind-the-scenes featurette; extensive cast and crew interviews; cast and production biographies; a still image gallery; the Gene Roddenberry's Earth: Final Conflict-No Refuge backstory; and Previews. Spoken Languages: English."]

raw_response:
**Preferences and Trends:**

- **Ratings & Enjoyment**: Strong inclination towards high-quality productions, consistently giving five-star reviews across various genres. 
- **Genres**: Preference for adventure, fantasy, drama, and compelling narratives, often gravitating toward thrillers and emotional stories.
- **Content Themes**: Interest in films and series exploring personal transformations, societal issues (especially within the LGBT sphere), and deep emotional connections.
- **Actor & Director Recognition**: Frequent purchases indicating a preference for established actors and directors, often returning to favorites like Janelle Monae, Michael Fassbender, and well-known studios such as 20th Century Fox.
- **Cinematic Elements**: Enjoyment of films with complex characters, emotional depth, and high production values, as evidenced by repeated selections from critically acclaimed titles.
- **Documentary Interest**: An openness to documentaries that delve into personal stories and societal themes, reflecting a diverse taste in cinema.
- **Rewatch Value**: Purchasing multiple seasons of series signifies a preference for shows with strong narratives and character development, particularly in dramas like "Wentworth Prison."
- **Family and Community Dynamics**: A recurring interest in movies exploring family relationships and identity, indicating a protective stance toward narratives that challenge societal norms.

Overall, this individual displays a well-rounded and thoughtful approach to viewing choices, favoring quality storytelling across various media formats.
